intro: Chaenorhinum klokovii, commonly known as the Klovkov's horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related species. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It produces striking, showy flowers with bright colors, often in shades of red or orange. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
